page.title: 16Southend:Local Broadcasting
page.content: A Radio station was begun in the town in 1982 and was called{Essex {Radio.}Since then it has grown considerably and now caters for the needs of the whole of Essex.It broadcasts all types of music and also organises road shows,fund-raising events and helplines for the old and disabled. Local and national news is broadcast every hour.The national news is collected from{Independent Radio {News.}The funds for the radio station are collected through advertisments which cost the companies Â£70 for every 60 seconds. Broadcasting starts at 5.30am and carries on continuously until 12.00 at night.On Sunday there are religious broadcasts from Churches as well as the normal selection of music.
